ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer.OdometerData
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends OdometerData
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class which updates the OdometerData's position by using the robot's motor's tachometer
    Author:
    Eliott Bourachot

                 EV3LargeRegulatedMotor motorR,
                 double TRACK,
                 double WHEEL_RAD)
          throws OdometerExceptions
        This is the default constructor of this class. It initiates all motors and variables once.It cannot be accessed externally.

    • Method Detail

      • getOdometer

        public static Odometer getOdometer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor motorL,
                                   EV3LargeRegulatedMotor motorR,
                                   double TRACK,
                                   double WHEEL_RAD)
                            throws OdometerExceptions
        This method is meant to ensure only one instance of the odometer is used throughout the code.
        Parameters:
        motorL- - the left motor
        motorR - - the right motor
        Returns:
        new or existing Odometer Object
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • getOdometer

        public static Odometer getOdometer()
                            throws OdometerExceptions
        This class is meant to return the existing Odometer Object. It is meant to be used only if an odometer object has been created
        Returns:
        error if no previous odometer exists
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is where the logic for the odometer will run. Use the methods provided from the OdometerData class to implement the odometer.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setStartingCoordinates

        public void setStartingCoordinates(int startingCorner)
        Corrects the odometer depending on the given starting corner. Should be used directly after having localized to the nearest intersection.
        Parameters:
        startingCorner -
